name: Ext.grid.plugin.CellEditing
doc:
The Ext.grid.plugin.CellEditing plugin injects editing at a cell level for a Grid. Only a single cell will be editable at a time. The field that will be used for the editor is defined at the editor. The editor can be a field instance or a field configuration.

If an editor is not specified for a particular column then that cell will not be editable and it will be skipped when activated via the mouse or the keyboard.

The editor may be shared for each column in the grid, or a different one may be specified for each column. An appropriate field type should be chosen to match the data structure that it will be editing. For example, to edit a date, it would be useful to specify Ext.form.field.Date as the editor.

Example

A grid with editor for the name and the email columns:

Ext.create('Ext.data.Store', {
    storeId: 'simpsonsStore',
    fields:[ 'name', 'email', 'phone'],
    data: [
        { name: 'Lisa', email: 'lisa@simpsons.com', phone: '555-111-1224' },
        { name: 'Bart', email: 'bart@simpsons.com', phone: '555-222-1234' },
        { name: 'Homer', email: 'homer@simpsons.com', phone: '555-222-1244' },
        { name: 'Marge', email: 'marge@simpsons.com', phone: '555-222-1254' }
    ]
});

Ext.create('Ext.grid.Panel', {
    title: 'Simpsons',
    store: Ext.data.StoreManager.lookup('simpsonsStore'),
    columns: [
        {header: 'Name', dataIndex: 'name', editor: 'textfield'},
        {header: 'Email', dataIndex: 'email', flex:1,
            editor: {
                xtype: 'textfield',
                allowBlank: false
            }
        },
        {header: 'Phone', dataIndex: 'phone'}
    ],
    selModel: 'cellmodel',
    plugins: {
        ptype: 'cellediting',
        clicksToEdit: 1
    },
    height: 200,
    width: 400,
    renderTo: Ext.getBody()
});

This requires a little explanation. We're passing in store and columns as normal, but we also specify a field on two of our columns. For the Name column we just want a default textfield to edit the value, so we specify 'textfield'. For the Email column we customized the editor slightly by passing allowBlank: false, which will provide inline validation.

To support cell editing, we also specified that the grid should use the 'cellmodel' selModel, and created an instance of the CellEditing plugin, which we configured to activate each editor after a single click.

members.name: clicksToEdit
members.doc: The number of clicks on a grid required to display the editor. The only accepted values are 1 and 2.
members.short_doc: The number of clicks on a grid required to display the editor. ...

members.name: triggerEvent
members.doc:
The event which triggers editing. Supersedes the clicksToEdit configuration. May be one of:

  • cellclick
  • celldblclick
  • cellfocus
  • rowfocus
members.short_doc: The event which triggers editing. ...

members.short_doc: cell, row, form ...

members.doc: Set to true while the editing plugin is active and an Editor is visible.

return.name: return
return.doc: Return false to cancel the editing process

members.name: startEdit
members.doc: Starts editing the specified record, using the specified Column definition to define which field is being edited.

params.name: record
params.doc: The Store data record which backs the row to be edited, or index of the record.

params.name: columnHeader
params.doc: The Column object defining the column to be edited, or index of the column.

members.short_doc: Starts editing the specified record, using the specified Column definition to define which field is being edited. ...

members.name: startEditByPosition

params.name: position
params.doc:
A position with keys of row and column. Example usage:

cellEditing.startEditByPosition({
    row: 3,
    column: 2
});

members.short_doc: Starts editing by position (row/column) ...

members.name: beforeedit
members.doc: Fires before cell editing is triggered. Return false from event handler to stop the editing.

params.name: context
params.doc: An editing context event with the following properties:

properties.name: field
properties.doc: The name of the field being edited.

properties.name: rowIdx
properties.doc: The index of the row being edited.

properties.name: colIdx
properties.doc: The index of the column being edited.

properties.name: cancel
properties.doc: Set this to true to cancel the edit or return false from your handler.

members.short_doc: Fires before cell editing is triggered. ...

members.name: canceledit
members.doc: Fires when the user started editing a cell but then cancelled the edit.

params.name: context
params.doc: An edit event with the following properties:

properties.name: field
properties.doc: The name of the field being edited.

properties.name: rowIdx
properties.doc: The index of the row being edited.

properties.name: colIdx
properties.doc: The index of the column being edited.

members.short_doc: Fires when the user started editing a cell but then cancelled the edit. ...

members.name: edit
members.doc:
Fires after a cell is edited. Usage example:

grid.on('edit', function(editor, e) {
    // commit the changes right after editing finished
    e.record.commit();
});

params.name: context
params.doc: An editing context with the following properties:

properties.name: field
properties.doc: The name of the field being edited.

properties.name: rowIdx
properties.doc: The index of the row being edited.

properties.name: colIdx
properties.doc: The index of the column being edited.

members.short_doc: Fires after a cell is edited. ...

members.name: validateedit
members.doc:
Fires after a cell is edited, but before the value is set in the record. Return false from event handler to cancel the change.

Usage example showing how to remove the red triangle (dirty record indicator) from some records (not all). By observing the grid's validateedit event, it can be cancelled if the edit occurs on a targeted row (for example) and then setting the field's new value in the Record directly:

grid.on('validateedit', function(editor, e) {
  var myTargetRow = 6;

  if (e.row == myTargetRow) {
    e.cancel = true;
    e.record.data[e.field] = e.value;
  }
});

params.name: context
params.doc: An editing context with the following properties:

properties.name: field
properties.doc: The name of the field being edited.

properties.name: rowIdx
properties.doc: The index of the row being edited.

properties.name: colIdx
properties.doc: The index of the column being edited.

properties.name: cancel
properties.doc: Set this to true to cancel the edit or return false from your handler.

members.short_doc: Fires after a cell is edited, but before the value is set in the record. ...
